page.title: 03 Footpaths
page.content: Our survey showed that many footpaths had no{finger posts.}They were difficult to find and walk.Some footpaths have been ploughed over but most farmers were willing to help us find new or original routes.We saw many wild flowers,birds and also evidence of rabbits.The main crops are different types of corn,beans,peas and some sugar beet. Footpaths also ran alongside woodland and meadowland.Our area is rural and has poor public transport so many people own cars.We have deduced that there is {little regular use}of many of the footpaths so they have become overgrown or ploughed up and difficult to follow. However we feel they are {well worth preserving}as walking footpaths provides a wonderful way of viewing the countryside. We all enjoyed our walking immensely.
